title: Meet us — USC Annenberg Ambassadors
main_content: Meet the 2024-2025 Annenberg Ambassadors Team. Reach out to us on the Ask an Ambassador page if you want to know more about our involvements at USC! Meet Ambassador Martina Major: Public Relations Hometown: Rome, Italy/Miami, FL Graduation Year: 2025 The more I looked into the PR program and the school itself, the more I realized that Annenberg truly is at the top of innovation. Resources like the Media Center, the Adobe Digital Lounge, and the Annenberg student organizations, really caught my attention as I saw the possibility of academic, professional, and personal growth here at Annenberg. I also love that Annenberg is a smaller, tight knit community within the large school that is USC, so making connections and supporting one another is the norm. Meet Ambassador Kymia Major: Journalism Hometown: Venice, CA Graduation Year: 2025 So far, the highlight of my student experience has been all of the amazing people I have met as a student at Annenberg. From my bonding over homework with my coworkers at the Student Services office to chatting over Zoom with Annenberg research faculty, I am so convinced and proud of the people I have met during my time here. Meet Ambassador Kassydi Major: Journalism Hometown: Frisco, TX Graduation Year: 2025 My favorite class at Annenberg so far has been ASCJ200 with Professor Gordon Stables. The lectures were incredibly engaging and completely changed my perspective on modern media consumption. I also have improved my multimedia skills through the lab sessions where we got hands-on experience with Adobe programs. Meet Justin (Jinge) Li Major: Journalism Hometown: Guangzhou, China; Arcadia, CA Graduation Year: 2025 I chose to attend Annenberg because of the newsroom and the fantastic opportunity it offers. So far, my favorite memories of Annenberg have been interviewing Geroge Stephanopoulos for my Jour 207 class assignments. If you want to know how I met him, ask me next time you see me in the newsroom! Meet Charlotte Anderson Major: Public Relations Hometown: Denver, CO Graduation Year: 2025 I chose USC Annenberg because of the amazing resources and faculty that are available for students! I also was drawn to the prime location in Los Angeles and our unmatched reputation in communications. The thing that really sold me was the media center, which is an incredible space for students to learn hands-on media skills that we can take with us in our careers. I am so happy I chose Annenberg, and I could not be happier to be a Trojan! Meet Delaney Polocheck Major: Journalism Hometown: Houston, Texas Graduation Year: 2026 Annenberg's location at the heart of campus is representative of its role as a center through which the school’ss lifeblood flows, a place where students across all backgrounds, majors and perspectives can gather to collaborate and exchange ideas. With its fast-paced, dynamic curriculum, innovative media center and bustling atmosphere, you’re truly in the middle of everything at Annenberg—which, as a journalism major, is my favorite place to be. Meet Mallory North Major: Communication Hometown: Santa Monica, CA Graduation Year: 2025 What I love about USC Annenberg goes beyond just the classes. The possibilities and experiences offered through guest speakers, learning from professionals, and internship opportunities are unmatched. But my favorite part of being a Annenberg student is the camaraderie among students and professors. Since the first day of my freshman year, I have felt love and compassion from the Annenberg community. Meet Grace Davies Major: Communication Hometown: Oakland, CA Graduation Year: 2025 I transferred to Annenberg during my freshman year because I was seeking a major that would allow me to explore and discover my professional interests. Through Annenberg, I have learned how to bring a worldly view to any sort of communication as well as critical analysis skills. Furthermore, the professors and faculty at Annenberg are more supportive and caring than I ever could have imagined. All of my academic and professional goals within Annenberg are encouraged and celebrated, inspiring me to be a better student every day. Meet Nya Manneh Major: Communication Hometown: Plymouth, MN Graduation Year: 2025 I knew USC Annenberg was perfect for me because of my time interacting with the Annenberg community. While I was very unsure of what I wanted to do when I came to USC, I've been able to meet so many students and professors who have helped me see the many ways I could get involved in my many interests within the school. I found some of my first friends in our classes that we shared, and each professor I've had is adamant about helping students improve and learn inside and outside the classroom. I've been so lucky to have been able to join the ACCSA or write stories for the Media Center and Daily Trojan. These experiences and the diverse range of classes I've been able to take while here have helped me learn more about what kinds of stories I want to tell and have given me the skills I need to make a difference with my work. Meet Camille Figueroa Major: Communication (B.A.) Hometown: Camarillo, CA Graduation Year: 2025 I chose USC Annenberg for its wonderful Media Center that allows me to explore my passion for media production of journalism! The Spanish news desk I am a part of, Dimelo, feels like one big family! Meet Kassydi Rone Major: Journalism Hometown: Frisco, TX Graduation Year: 2025 Kassydi Rone is a rising senior studying Journalism with a minor in Cinematic Arts. She made the move from Frisco, Texas to Southern California to pursue the intersection of the fashion, entertainment and lifestyle beats more directly. She currently serves as the first Fashion Editor in Annenberg Media’s history and has held the titles of Creative Director and Social Media Manager for SCene Magazine since its inception. Meet Benti Kaur Major: Public Relations Hometown: Moorpark, CA Graduation Year: 2026 As a South-Asian Sikh woman, USC Annenberg has given me opportunities that I never would have dreamed to be possible. I am continuously amazed to see the ways in which my peers and I are able to get involved and make an impact on the USC community through Annenberg's various resources. My passions and interests are constantly reinforced by the students and faculty's encouragement. Meet Eric GyuMin Choi Major: Communication Hometown: Seoul, South Korea / London, England Graduation Year: 2025 Eric GyuMin Choi is a student and storyteller from Korea with a fervent passion for news media, politics, and technology. Eric is studying Communication and Business and is involved in on-campus business organizations and Annenberg Media as News Anchor and Director. As an international and internal transfer student (originally majoring in Political Science), Eric hopes to share his love for USC Annenberg and support the community by representing the school and helping the next generation of the Trojan family. Fight On! Meet Sully Barthel Major: Journalism Hometown: Shrewsbury, MA (Boston area) Graduation Year: 2025 Coming from a smaller town in Massachusetts, it’s incredibly exciting to study journalism in one of the world’s most diverse cities and a huge cultural capital. Los Angeles — and Annenberg — are buzzing with people who are eager to connect with their communities, and I love that Annenberg offers so many hands-on opportunities to engage with these communities. Meet Victor Ye Major: Communication Hometown: Hacienda Heights, CA Graduation Year: 2025 Victor Ye is a student at USC studying Communication, with passions in the intersections of media, politics, and business. He is involved in Annenberg Media as an Arts, Culture, and Entertainment Section contributor, and previously at Daily Trojan as a features writer. He is proud to represent Annenberg, and attributes many of his personal and academic achievements with personable faculty and close friends made at the school. Meet Jill Ofodu Major: Communication Hometown: San Ramon, CA (Bay Area) Graduation Year: 2027 Jill Ofodu is a USC student majoring in Communication with a minor in Cinematic Arts. She is deeply immersed in pop culture, video editing, and all facets of social media. She's currently involved on campus as the African American Cinema Society's Assistant Marketing Director, Administrative Chair, and PR Chair of McCarthy Honor's College, where she uses her communication skills and media knowledge. With a genuine dedication to USC Annenberg, she fosters community engagement and creative expression within the university. Meet Keira Beller Major: Communication Hometown: Los Angeles, CA Graduation Year: 2027 Growing up surrounded by the media world in LA, I always knew I wanted to join this field of producers and creators who strategically provide us with news, entertainment, and more. USC Annenberg has offered me countless opportunities to explore different avenues within the broad domain of media and communications that could not be found elsewhere. Involvement in co-curricular activities like Annenberg TV News has allowed me to develop new skills and career goals, and feel that I learn something new about myself each semester. Every day at Annenberg is exciting, and I'm incredibly grateful to be a part of the Annenberg family and have the chance to give back as an ambassador. Meet Malcolm Ferrouillet Major: Public Relations & Advertising Hometown: New Orleans, Louisiana Graduation Year: 2027 I chose USC Annenberg because of the family feeling when I first walked into the building. In education, I am a firm believer that you should feel comfortable in environments that you will spend a lot of time within. From faculty to students, Annengerg never fails to make a student feel seen and make their mark not only within the school, but at the University of Southern California. If you want that family feeling and the best college experience, Annenberg is the place for you. Meet Jayden Higman Major: B.A. in Journalism & B.S. in Business Administration Hometown: San Diego, CA Graduation Year: 2026 I've found myself completely enthralled with what resources and endless opportunities I have at the tip of my fingers as an Annenberg student. Though a late comer into Annenberg's journalism program, I immediately felt welcomed by professors and faculty as well as motivated to match my peers' success inside and outside of the classroom. Annenberg really works to accelerate students' academic/professional achievements and encompasses the diversity and innovation required for such a progressive environment. Meet Alexa Rubinstein Major: Communication Hometown: Delray Beach, FL Graduation Year: 2028 I chose Annenberg for the wide array of opportunities, strong industry connections, and diverse range of classes offered by accomplished and inspiring professors. Meet Ally Nakamura Major: Journalism Hometown: West Hills, CA Graduation Year: 2028 I chose USC Annenberg because it is one of the best schools for journalism in the country. Annenberg offers so many unique opportunities that I know will help me in my future career. Being located in one of the major cultural hubs in the world, there is an abundance of resources in Los Angeles that Annenberg offers to students. When I took my tour of the school, I knew it was the place for me! Meet Abigail Abrams Major: Public Relations and Advertising Hometown: Knoxville, TN Graduation Year: 2028 Coming from out of state, Annenberg was a huge reason why I chose USC! The campus is very large, but Annenberg helped make it feel small. When I first toured the campus, I immediately fell in love with Annenberg. Being able to learn from world-class faculty, listening to amazing panels, and touring PR agencies has been surreal. The endless opportunities that they provide are amazing, from working in the world-renowned media center to being involved in a student-run PR firm. I love how I can use my knowledge of PR to work in my desired field of either politics or entertainment. I am very excited to see what new opportunities come and grateful to be able to give back to this Annenberg community as an ambassador Meet Shriya Karuturi Major: Public Relations and Advertising Hometown: Bangalore, India Graduation Year: 2028 Annenberg was my dream school because of its unparalleled opportunities in media and communication, its location in the heart of LA, and its vibrant, creative community. Being surrounded by industry leaders, innovative thinkers, and hands-on experiences makes Annenberg the perfect place to grow, connect, and turn my passion for storytelling into a career. Meet Christian Dotimas Major: Public Relations and Advertising Hometown: Hayward, CA Graduation Year: 2028 I chose Annenberg because of the abundance of unique opportunities, especially in the heart of Los Angeles. Annenberg's highly recognized and well-established faculty, state-of-the-art media center, and inviting community helped me ensure that I was receiving the best education possible. I am falling in love with Annenberg more and more, not only because of the classes but also because of the best people I have ever met here. Meet Gracie Imes Major: Public Relations and Advertising Hometown: Austin, TX Graduation Year: 2028 Annenberg is uniquely committed to fostering a supportive environment while challenging students to achieve their greatest potential. At Annenberg, students are constantly encouraged to collaborate with one another through group projects, in-class discussions, and even joint study sessions. Annenberg's faculty serve not only as expert professors, but also as invaluable mentors who ensure students are prepared to succeed in any field they pursue. Through its media center and variety of publications, Annenberg offers its students with real-world opportunities and learning experiences that are hardly available anywhere else. I am incredibly grateful to be studying at Annenberg, where every day, something new inspires or challenges me toward becoming an impactful professional. Meet Owen Galster Major: Communication Hometown: Washington, D.C. Graduation Year: 2028 I chose Annenberg because I knew it would provide me countless opportunities to study what I am passionate about, get involved in extracurriculars related to my studies, and find a community with others with the same interests as me. I was excited about getting real-world experience through volunteering and working in the Annenberg Media Center, which I knew was such a unique opportunity that only USC Annenberg could offer. I also knew I wanted to come to Los Angeles with the goal of working in the entertainment industry, and I knew Annenberg would set me up to achieve those dreams. Meet Ava Nicols Major: Journalism Hometown: Manhattan Beach, CA Graduation Year: 2028 I chose Annenberg because I want to be part of a team of staff and students who help create a unique impact in the communication industry and encourage each other to figure out where our skills can be the most helpful. Before I got to USC, I wrote for and led my high school newspaper but I didn’t realize the crucial role journalism plays in the industries aside from print we as humans rely on day-to-day. I remember during my new student orientation there was a panel of Annenberg Ambassadors who each shared their different experiences in the programs they were involved in, classes they took, or things they hoped to accomplish. I especially remembered the undeniably positive and collaborative energy these students radiated, their honesty and their admitting stories of rejection and redirection. Feeling overwhelmed with opportunity, I knew that whatever I decided to join, I hoped to see myself sitting on that panel among other ambitious students at some point too. Over the past few months, I have had the opportunity to write and edit digital content for Annenberg media, take photos, write research articles, interview Olympic athletes, and work with Fortune 500 PR industry leaders through the USC Center for Public Relations. And now starting this semester, I will continue growing while serving as a resource for students, like my first-semester myself, in need of direction about how to make the most of my experience at such a special school. I am continuously overwhelmed by the fact that in just one semester as part of the Trojan family I have developed so much as a communicator and person. I am so grateful to have chosen Annenberg and you should too! Meet Maria Laguna Major: Journalism Hometown: Coronado, CA Graduation Year: 2028 Annenberg is a thriving community of ambitious creatives and its innovative immersion into the journalism industry makes it the perfect place for me to prepare for my future career in media! Meet Autumn Brown Major: Public Relations and Advertising Hometown: Carson, CA Graduation Year: 2027 I chose Annenberg because it’s where I discovered my passion and found my place at USC. Enrolling in COMM 321 on a whim opened my eyes to the dynamic world of communication and media, and I immediately knew I was in the right place. From hands-on learning opportunities to a collaborative and inspiring community, Annenberg has given me the tools to grow both academically and professionally. I’m grateful for everything I’ve gained here and excited to help others find their own paths within this incredible school. Meet Olivia Hau Major: Journalism Hometown: Palo Alto, CA Graduation Year: 2027 I chose Annenberg because of the amazing opportunities that the school offers. There is no better place to explore the media landscape than at the heart of LA. The community that I have found at Annenberg, both personally and professionally, have enriched my college experience so much. Meet Cecilia Yu Major: Public Relations and Advertising Hometown: Beijing, China / Charlottesville, VA Graduation Date: 2028 I chose Annenberg because it has been my dream school since freshman year in high school. I've always been interested in PR, communication, and marketing while growing up. After visiting USC and Annenberg for the first time my Junior year, I know this is where I am meant to be. Not just due to the fact that it holds the top PR and Communication program in the country, but also the close-knit community, care, and support all the professors and faculties have for each student. USC is my school, and Annenberg is my home away from home. Meet Lena Palomares Major: Public Relations and Advertising Hometown: Glenwood Springs, CO Graduation Date: 2026 For me, Annenberg has been all about access—to opportunities, to people, and to experiences I never would have found on my own. I’ve gained real, hands-on experience that goes beyond the classroom, and the connections I’ve made here have helped me navigate my career in ways I didn’t expect. It’s not just about what you learn—it’s about actually applying it and having people who support you along the way. That’s why I chose Annenberg.
